intro: Hieracium budense, commonly known as the Balkan hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tubular and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowering period occurs from June to August, producing yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium budense is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
